text:
We've been migrating workloads
into AWS for over four years

now, and we've grown to several thousand
AWS accounts.

At the scale that we're operating in AWS,
we need to have a way to be able

to efficiently manage
all of those workloads

across those thousands of accounts,
and also allow our teams

to effectively continue
to migrate into AWS at scale.

So we're using Amazon CloudWatch today
to collect infrastructure metrics

for how our infrastructure in AWS
is performing so that we can

identify cost optimization opportunities
and just monitor the overall health

of our infrastructure
across thousands of accounts in AWS.

The work that we’ve been doing with AWS
has enabled our teams in general to move

faster in terms of getting production
readiness workloads

out the door to the tune of 85% faster
rate of delivery.
With the insights

that we have using AWS Cloud Operations﻿
and the data that it provides

us, we're able to build products
that are faster, more performant,

and more readily available for customers
around the globe.

So using, again, kind of the metrics
and insights that we get through

AWS Cloud Operations﻿,
we can ensure that our customers

are receiving the best experience
that they deserve

with the GoDaddy products
that we're launching globally.
